evidence.text: The Parties should be prepared to address the following case at the hearing: Atterbury v. U.S. Marshals Serv., 805 F.3d 398 (2d Cir. 2015)

extracted.value: Atterbury v. U.S. Marshals Serv., 805 F.3d 398 (2d Cir. 2015)

evidence.text: The case remains pending in the District Court with no appeal filed. The Opinion and Order (Docket #57) addresses the preliminary injunction motion, and no appellate filing or court is mentioned in any document.

ORDER GRANTING TEMPORARY RESTRAINING ORDER AND ORDER TO SHOW CAUSE WHY A PRELIMINARY INJUNCTION SHOULD NOT ISSUE granting 5 Motion for TRO; with respect to 5 Motion for Preliminary Injunction. ORDERED that the motion for a Temporary Restraining Order is GRANTED. It is further ORDERED that Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants are ENJOINED from enforcing, implementing, maintaining or giving effect to the elimination of the Job Corps program, including the stop work orders and termination and non-renewal notices delivered to Job Corps center operators starting May 29, 2025; from issuing, enforcing, implementing, maintaining or giving effect to any shutdown tasks, job terminations, or student removals; and from taking any further action to eliminate the Job Corps program without Congressional authorization.

extracted.value: On June 4, 2025, the court granted the Emergency Motion for Temporary Restraining Order, enjoining Defendants from enforcing the elimination of the Job Corps program, including stop work orders and termination notices, and set a show cause hearing for June 17, 2025

evidence.text: EMERGENCY MOTION for Temporary Restraining Order ., MOTION for Preliminary Injunction . Document filed by Adams and Associates, Inc., Alternate Perspectives, Inc., Education & Training Resources, LLC, National Job Corps Association, Jocelyn Rivera, Strategix Management, LLC, Transportation Communications Union/IAM. (Attachments: # 1 Proposed Order Granting Temporary Restraining Order and Order to Show Cause Why a Preliminary Injunction Should Not Issue).

extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed an Emergency Motion for Temporary Restraining Order and Preliminary Injunction on June 3, 2025, seeking to enjoin Defendants from enforcing the elimination of the Job Corps program, including stop work orders and termination notices effective May 29, 2025

evidence.text: The case is at the preliminary injunction stage with no trial scheduled. Docket entries reference 'Order to Show Cause Hearing for Preliminary Injunction' (Docket #53) and 'TRO extended until June 25, 2025' (Docket #54), but no trial proceedings or scheduling information.
